sen.j: 東伏見宮（ひがしふしみのみや）は、明治後期に伏見宮邦家親王の王子、東伏見宮依仁親王が創立した宮家。
sen.e: The Higashifushiminomiya family is the Imperial family, which was founded by Imperial Prince Yorihito Higashifushiminomiya, a son of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie, in the late Meiji Era.
The Higashifushiminomiya family is the Imperial family, which was founded by Imperial Prince Yorihito Higashifushiminomiya, a son of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie, during the late Meiji Era.
The Higashifushiminomiya family is the Imperial family, which was founded by Imperial Prince Higashifushiminomiya Yorihito, a son of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie, during the late Meiji Era.
sen.cmt: "Imperial Prince Higashifushiminomiya Yorihito"に統一しました。

sen.j: 継嗣は無く、宮家としては一代で断絶した。
sen.e: Since there have been no heir, the Imperial family was ended in the first generation.
Since there has been no heir, the Imperial family ended in the first generation.
Since there has been no heir, the Imperial family ended in the first generation.

sen.j: 依仁親王は、1867年（慶応3年）に誕生。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Yorihito was born in 1867.
Imperial Prince Yorihito was born in 1867.
Imperial Prince Yorihito was born in 1867.
His childhood name was Prince Sadamaro.
His childhood name was Prince Sadamaro.
His childhood name was Prince Sadamaro.

sen.j: 1869年（明治2年）に山階宮の養子となり山階宮定麿王を名乗った。
sen.e: In 1869, he was adopted by the Yamasinanomiya family and called Prince Yamasinanomiya Sadamaro.
In 1869, he was adopted by the Yamasinanomiya family and called Prince Yamasinanomiya Sadamaro.
In 1869, he was adopted by the Yamashinanomiya family and called Prince Yamashinanomiya Sadamaro.

sen.j: 1885年（明治18年）に小松宮の養子となる。
sen.e: In 1885, he was adopted by the Komatsunomiya family.
In 1885, he was adopted by the Komatsunomiya family.
In 1885, he was adopted by the Komatsunomiya family.

sen.j: 翌年、親王宣下により小松宮依仁親王となった。
sen.e: In the following year, he was given the title of Imperial Prince and became Imperial Prince Komatsunomiya Yorihito.
In the following year, he was given the title of Imperial Prince and became Imperial Prince Komatsunomiya Yorihito.
In the following year, he was given the title of Imperial Prince and became Imperial Prince Komatsunomiya Yorihito.

sen.j: 1903年（明治36年）、小松宮彰仁親王は薨去するさいに依仁親王の継嗣を停止したため、依仁親王は新たに東伏見宮家を創設した。
sen.e: Since Imperial Prince Yorihito did not became the heir when Imperial Prince Komatsunomiya Akihito deceased in 1903, Imperial Prince Yorihito newly created the Higashifushiminomiya family
Since Imperial Prince Yorihito did not became an heir when Imperial Prince Komatsunomiya Akihito died in 1903, Imperial Prince Yorihito newly created the Higashifushiminomiya family
Since Imperial Prince Yorihito did not become an heir when Imperial Prince Komatsunomiya Akihito died in 1903, Imperial Prince Yorihito newly created the Higashifushiminomiya family

sen.j: 軍歴としては、1884年（明治17年）に英国留学。
sen.e: His military career began when he studied in England in 1884.
His military career began when he studied in England in 1884.
His military career began when he studied in England in 1884.

sen.j: さらに、1890年（明治23年）フランス・ブレヒト海軍兵学校を卒業し、その後、横須賀鎮守府司令長官、第二艦隊司令長官を歴任し、海軍大将に上る。
sen.e: He graduated from Naval Academy in Brest, France in 1890, then he became the admiral of Yokosuka Chinju-fu (navy base), admiral of the Second Fleet, and then the full admiral.
sen.cmt: Brest has been the seat of the French Naval Academy since 1830. http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/78900/Brest, http://www.ecole-navale.fr/
sen.e: He graduated from the Naval Academy in Brest, France in 1890, then he became the admiral of Yokosuka Chinju-fu (navy base), admiral of the Second Fleet, and then the full admiral.
He graduated from the Naval Academy in Brest, France in 1890, then he became the admiral of Yokosuka Chinju-fu (navy base), admiral of the Second Fleet, and then the full admiral.

sen.j: また、英国ジョージ5世 (イギリス王)の戴冠式に参列し、大日本水産会総裁、日仏協会名誉総裁などを歴任。
sen.e: Moreover, he attended the coronation of George V (King of the United Kingdom) and hold prominent positions such as the President of Japan Fisheries Association and the honorary president of La Societe Franco-Japonaise.

Moreover, he attended the coronation of George V (King of the United Kingdom) and held prominent positions such as the President of Japan Fisheries Association and the honorary president of La Societe Franco-Japonaise.

Moreover, he attended the coronation of George V (King of the United Kingdom) and held prominent positions such as the President of Japan Fisheries Association and the honorary president of La Societe Franco-Japonaise.
He deceased at the age of 56 in 1920.
He died at the age of 56 in 1920.
He died at the age of 56 in 1920.

sen.j: 元帥大勲位菊花章頚飾を追号された。
sen.e: He was posthumously awarded the marshal Collar of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.
He was posthumously awarded the marshal Collar of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.
He was posthumously awarded the marshal Collar of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.

sen.j: 依仁親王には、継嗣が無く東伏見宮家は一代で断絶した。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Yorihito did not have his heir, therefore, the Higashifushiminomiya family was ended in one generation.
Imperial Prince Yorihito did not have an heir, therefore, the Higashifushiminomiya family ended in one generation.
Imperial Prince Yorihito did not have an heir, therefore, the Higashifushiminomiya family ended in one generation.

sen.j: しかし、依仁親王が養育していた久邇宮邦彦王第3王子邦英王（東伏見慈洽）が成人後、東伏見宮の祭祀を受継ぐために臣籍降下することで東伏見の家名を賜り、伯爵家となった。
sen.e: However, Prince Kuninomiya Kuniyoshi's third Prince Kunihide (Jigo HIGASHIFUSHIMI), who was raised by Imperial Prince Yorihito, was given the family name of HIGASHIFUSHIMI by demotion from nobility to subject in order to inherit the religious service of the Higashifushiminomiya, after being reached legal age, and the family became count.

However, Prince Kuninomiya Kuniyoshi's third Prince Kunihide (Jigo HIGASHIFUSHIMI), who was raised by Imperial Prince Yorihito, was given the family name of HIGASHIFUSHIMI by demotion from nobility to subject in order to inherit the religious service of the Higashifushiminomiya, after reaching legal age, and the family became count.

However, Prince Kuninomiya Kuniyoshi's third Prince Kunihide (Jigo HIGASHIFUSHIMI), who was raised by Imperial Prince Yorihito, was given the family name of HIGASHIFUSHIMI by demotion from nobility to subject in order to inherit the religious service of the Higashifushiminomiya, after reaching legal age, and the family became count.

sen.j: この臣籍降下は旧皇室典範が養子を禁止していたためであった。
sen.e: The demotion was carried out since the Former Imperial House Act did not allowed to have an adopted child.
The demotion was carried out since the Former Imperial House Act did not allowed having an adopted child.
The demotion was carried out since the Former Imperial House Act did not allow having an adopted child.

sen.j: その後邦英は京都の青蓮院門跡の門主となって東伏見慈洽と号した。
sen.e: After that, Kunihide became the chief priest of Shoren-in Monzeki Temple and was named Jigo HIGASHIFUSHIMI.
After that, Kunihide became the chief priest of Shoren-in Monzeki Temple and was named Jigo HIGASHIFUSHIMI.
After that, Kunihide became the chief priest of Shoren-in Monzeki Temple and was named Jigo HIGASHIFUSHIMI.
He is alive at present.
He is alive at present.
He is alive at present.
